#
# Data product developed by Dr. E. Thiemann from the
# Laboratory for Atmospheric and Space Physics, Boulder, Colorado
# in the frame of the PROBA2 guest investigator program.
#
# Please address your questions to E. Thiemann (thiemann@lasp.colorado.edu) and
# to the LYRA Principal Investigator M. Dominique (marie.dominique@oma.be)
#
# PROBA2 data products are open to all.
# Users should however refer to the following paper: http://arxiv.org/abs/1708.08833
# and acknowledge the instrument according to the rules described
# at http://proba2.oma.be/data/termsOfUse in their papers and presentations
#
# Website reference http://proba2.oma.be/lyra/data/EarthAtmosphere/
#
# Description:
# Summed neutral N2 and O number density profiles, spanning altitudes between 150 and 400 km
# retrieved from LYRA data acquired during occultations by the unit 3 (backup unit) zirconium
# channel (bandpass: 1-2 nm + 6-20 nm).
#
# Radial distance is the distance from the center of Earth expressed in km to which the density corresponds.
# Density O-N2 provides the summed number density of neutral O and N2 in units of radial distance and cm^-3.
# The systematic error is a signed value (asymmetric) in fractional units and is primarily from the error made by
# assuming that the absorption cross-sections of O and N2 are equal; a secondary source of systematic error is 
# from using a single-scale height atmosphere in the reference atmosphere used by the retrieval algorithm.
# The random error is an unsigned value (to be applied symmetrically to the measurement) in fractional
# units and gathers the uncertainties from solar spectra, solar variability and measurement noise.
# Both uncertainties are described in http://arxiv.org/abs/1708.08833.
# The Longitude and Latitude (in degrees) columns refer to the tangential point along the
# line-of-sight, where most of the absorption occurs.
#
# Scale height =        57.656970 km
# Date (UTC) = 2015-01-26T10:00:08.058
# Date (julian) = 2457048.91675993
#
# Radial distance	Density O-N2	Systematic error	Random error	Longitude	Latitude
       6484.9599	   9.5397572e+10	     0.024350298	     0.027747906	       100.93639	       49.099141
       6487.4141	   8.3882905e+10	     0.032014414	     0.028487961	       101.09324	       48.899509
